importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Limp Bizkit was formed in 1994, marking the beginning of their influential role in shaping the nu-metal genre and bringing heavy music into the mainstream.
Sam Rivers received the Gibson Award for Best Bassist in 2000, highlighting his recognition as a top-tier bassist in the music industry.
Sam Rivers left Limp Bizkit in 2015 due to liver disease from excessive drinking, illustrating his personal struggle with health and his journey toward recovery.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame from 1994 to 2025 spans Limp Bizkit’s rise to fame and the recent period of mourning and tribute following Sam Rivers' death, emphasizing the legacy of the band and its impact over decades.

keyTakeAways: Sam Rivers, the founding bassist of Limp Bizkit, died at the age of 48, leaving a significant void in the band and the nu-metal music scene.
Rivers was not only a musical pioneer with a distinctive bass style but also a deeply influential presence in the band's creative and emotional core, described as 'the soul in the sound'.
Limp Bizkit, formed in 1994, helped define the nu-metal genre with its hip-hop rock style and expletive-laden lyrics, contributing to heavy music's mainstream success.

Their key albums include *Significant Other* and *Chocolate Starfish and the Hot Dog Flavored Water*, and singles like *Take a Look Around* and *Rollin' (Air Raid Vehicle)* achieved major commercial success.

Rivers' health struggles, particularly liver disease from excessive drinking, were publicly disclosed, and he underwent a successful liver transplant after quitting alcohol and following medical advice.
Rivers was awarded the Gibson Award for Best Bassist in 2000, underscoring his professional recognition in the music industry.
The band released a new single, *Making Love to Morgan Wallen*, and performed at the Reading Festival, indicating ongoing musical activity despite the loss of a core member.
Beyond music, Rivers was recognized for his charitable work, and the band acknowledged his impact on lives through both music and community efforts.
Rivers left the band in 2015 and has not returned, with the band noting it has been four years since their last album, *Still Suck*.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Sam Rivers, the founding bassist of the influential US nu-metal band Limp Bizkit, has died at the age of 48. The band described him as 'the soul in the sound' and emphasized his irreplaceable musical and emotional presence. Limp Bizkit, formed in 1994, played a defining role in bringing heavy music to the mainstream with hits like 'Rollin' (Air Raid Vehicle)' and albums such as *Significant Other* and *Chocolate Starfish and the Hot Dog Flavored Water*. Rivers, who left the band in 2015 due to liver disease from excessive drinking, underwent a successful liver transplant and was recognized with the Gibson Award for Best Bassist in 2000. The band released a new single, 'Making Love to Morgan Wallen,' and performed at the Reading Festival, showing ongoing activity. Their tribute to Rivers also highlighted his charitable work and the deep personal bonds shared with band members, underscoring his lasting impact on both music and lives.
title: Limp Bizkit bassist Sam Rivers dies aged 48
